head.title: National News Briefs; 2 Colorado Wildfires Destroy Dozens of Homes

hedline.hl1: National News Briefs; 2 Colorado Wildfires Destroy Dozens of Homes

abstract.p: Two Colorado wildfires continue to burn out of control, destroying dozens of homes (S)

block.p: Dry and windy conditions kept two wildfires in Colorado burning out of control today and at least 700 people from returning to see if their homes had survived overnight. Dozens of houses were destroyed.

The Bobcat Gulch fire, east of Rocky Mountain National Park, is believed to have been started by an illegal campfire. The Hi Meadow fire, about 35 miles southwest of Denver near the town of Bailey, was caused by lightning, officials said.

Dry and windy conditions kept two wildfires in Colorado burning out of control today and at least 700 people from returning to see if their homes had survived overnight. Dozens of houses were destroyed.

The Bobcat Gulch fire, east of Rocky Mountain National Park, is believed to have been started by an illegal campfire. The Hi Meadow fire, about 35 miles southwest of Denver near the town of Bailey, was caused by lightning, officials said.

The Hi Meadow fire had burned more than 4,500 acres by this afternoon, destroying 29 houses in several subdivisions, The Associated Press reported. The Bobcat Gulch fire had consumed more than 5,000 acres and at least 7 to 10 homes. Four firefighters were treated for minor injuries today, The Associated Press said.
